elements.title: Maximiliano Hernández Martínez (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Maximiliano Hernández Martínez (pictured) believed that hanging colored lights across San Salvador would cure a smallpox epidemic?

elements.title: a lane behind a tenement in Edinburgh (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a lane behind a tenement in Edinburgh is decorated as a Wild West town?

elements.title: a German pastor (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a German pastor let a deposed East German head of state stay in his house?

elements.title: the 2024 American remake (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 2024 American remake of Have I Got News for You has a permanent host, something that the original show dispensed with in 2002?

elements.title: Pete Wade (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when guitarist Pete Wade was 19, he moved to Nashville with $3, his suitcase, two ham sandwiches, and the telephone numbers of Don Helms and Jerry Rivers?

elements.title: a tornado near Chicago (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a tornado near Chicago was produced by a storm with a hydrodynamical helicity four times higher than the threshold favorable for tornadogenesis?

elements.title: Victoria Siddall (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Victoria Siddall is the first woman to be appointed the director of the 168-year-old National Portrait Gallery in London?

elements.title: The Taehongdang Party Secretary (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that North Korean series The Taehongdang Party Secretary was created to help promote the consumption of potatoes during a rice shortage?

elements.title: a baby penguin from Australia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a baby penguin from Australia is "an absolute unit"?
